content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
Early Access Review
Keep in mind, that I'm reviewing the current state of development.My ImpressionOriginally posted by FriendOfMine:I never thought this game would actually be so much fun!This pretty much sums it up. You will hear so much swearing, cheering and laughing playing this game the way it's supposed to be played - with your friends.TL;DRHere is my shortcut; the hole in one for this review.PositiveMediocreNegative+ Pretty maps~ not even a handful yet- Not optimized+ Different ways/paths to hit+ Custom Modifier- No Steam Integration~ The UI could use an overhaul+ Zooming in and out is possible- No free camera+ Relaxing Soundtrack~ some might find annoyingThe GameplayIt's Golfing - as easy as it gets - you hold the mouse button, move the mouse to change the strength and direction of your shot and release to hit the ball.You can also zoom in and out to get a better idea of the location of your goal, but sometimes it is obscured by obstacles so you won't be able to see where to hit at all - I really wish there was a free camera so you could inspect the level beforehand.The LevelsCurrently, there are 4 different levels: Forest, Desert, Moonlight Park, Spooky Mansion. An additional 2 are supposedly planned.Each map contains 18 holes and at least in the forest level you can finish it with 18 shots - but this will take you a lot of practice.The design is really neat and most of the time you can take more than one approach to hitting the ball.With to the many possibilities comes a big part of the replay value and the whole fun of the game. If you manage that one insane hit, none of your friends even thought about and you leave them wondering how you managed the hole in 2 strokes when they are on the 7th.MultiplayerCreating and joining a lobby is super easy, as well as setting up modifiers. Another big part of replaying this game will come from setting up different modifications - such as 'random ball shapes'. When the unlucky one with the acorn hits the hole in one - a♥♥♥♥♥♥storm will be unleashed :DHowever before even going into multiplayer, I advise you to paint your ball under 'Customize' - so you can be recognised by your friends. Just don't take the same colours.On the downside: you can't join a game through steam yet, which is a shame since you have to leaf through a few pages of games to find the one you are looking for.The VisualsAll the levels are really neatly designed and have a really cool air about them, to match a certain theme and bring you in the mood.The Forest, for example, is an all outside map, with a timber mill and saws and rolling logs around the place.The Desert features a pyramid theme with a sphinx and switches from an open-air level to an indoor level around the way.Moonlight Park is the currently only night level which has a really different feel from the other maps, it's quite magical.Last but not least in the mansion you will play all indoors and have ghosts spooking around as well as weird statues and trophies as well as cobwebs all over the place.However, in the current state of the game, some locations will just eat away your framerate - so you might have a look at your settings.The SoundI really like the sweet melody in the background, my friend, however, turned the volume way down because he couldn't stand it - so it's really a preference thing.The VerdictIf you have friends willing to play this game with you - by all means you can have a good time.However, there isn't that much content in the game yet. Of course, you can aim for the hole in one on every map (if this is even possible; I don't think it is), hone your skills by trying new hits and playing with funny settings but it depends on how long you and your friends will stay motivated together - because if the first one loses the interest, the others will probably follow.Also: always play with Collision - on. HateThank me later.Note:If you have read this far - thank you.I hope this review helped you in deciding to buy this game and if it did, I would be grateful for a 'thumbs up', if you didn't like it, you can give me a 'thumbs down' but I would be glad to hear your opinion on what you didn't like.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								10/10 Golf with your Friends is honestly worthy of GOTY. Here's why;Music: The music is mind-blowing for lack of better words. It is capable of giving you a wide arrange of fealings from happiness to legitimate depression and agony. I would absolutely recommend turning it up to max as you enjoy/scream through your game of Mini-Golf with your friends. The composer has truely accomplished a feat with the one repeating song that plays throughout the entire game. Physics: The physics in this game are surprisingly realistic and fair. That is, unless you change them so you're on the moon. Which brings me to my next point.Options/Customization: Do you not like your white ball? Change it to hot pink! Not like that you can't collide with your friends? Make it so you can! Not like the gravity? Drag a bar and take a trip to Mars! Not like being in 3rd Person? Use the scroll wheel to go into 1st Person mode! I was actually surprised with the amount of things you could change in this game, which is actually cheaper than the average sandwhich. Use that logic to convince your friends to buy this game so you don't have to play it by yourself. Trust me, It worked for me.Overall Graphics: For an early access game this is top tier. Honestly. The screenshots aren't cutscenes, there actually aren't any cutscenes in this game, I mean it's mini-golf why would there be? All the screenshots are in game footage. Crazy huh?It's Balanced: All the courses in this game are very well balanced, which suprised me since this is a golfing game. (aside for the ones you can access by turning on beta content, those need some work. Like ffs the Twilight map is hard af) Blacklight Interactive has done something spectacular with this game and I cannot wait for the Bogey Boy DLC. Great work guys.

number of helpful: 94 of 115 people (82%) found this review helpful15 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is a solid golf simulation game developed and published by Blacklight Interactive. Blacklight has three employees with two owners of which are brothers. The game itself is currently in Early Access, therefore, I will not harshly critique this review. The issues I will mentionI have placed in the forums for the developers to note down and fix in the future. The idea of this game is similar to real life golf, you complete levels whilst attempting to achieve the lowest score compared to your opponent in order to win. I really enjoyed this game and it was thanks to playing with friends, as the title suggests, because it creates competition between you and your friends and allows you all to have fun. The overall idea is simple, you play golf. The game features a lobby with recently-added filters to separate the password servers from the non-password servers. The filters feature is crucial to the matchmaking component of this game because as the title suggests, there are many more password-locked servers that are friends playing with friends instead of people playing with the community. You can play with up to 12 friends in multiplayer, adding a nice balance between friends playing and not over-doing it with friends per say. The three maps of Forest, Oasis, and the new map Twlight are all well designed. Forest is relatively basic but gradually increases in difficulty as the levels progress, which is beneficial to new players. Forest has a course surrounded by trees and it features some neat obstacles like spinning blades, rolling logs, and even targets that help you shoot towards the hole. Oasis is a level that is influenced by Egypt in its sandy landscape and it's pyramids with Holes within a pyramid. I like the level because it contrasts Forest and has water, thus it provides a difference with the maps. Furthermore, it's fairly difficult so I do like the challenge and map design of Oasis. Twlight is a standard golf course featuring different Holes. What makes it unique though is that it incorporates more water than Oasis and the course takes place at night, showcasing the luscious environment. Twlight allows you to step back and relax so you can enjoy the overall scenery. Twlight is my favourite course due to the night time and lights effect. Despite the small amount of features, the game has a clear direction with a simple concept and it delivers on that. Furthermore, the developers are absolutely excellent at communicating with the community on a daily basis if its informing them on direction, such as a roadmap, or responding to general queries. Blacklight is committed to this game and it shows in their work ethic because from when I purchased the game to now, the game has drastically improved and it feels more fluid than before. I played this on both my PC and my Macbook Air 2015 edition and there were differences in performance between both systems. My experience of this game on the Macbook was days after purchasing the game last month. Performance on it was choppy at best as the game lagged consistently despite my system surpassing the recommendations and despite me playing on low settings. My friend has a newer and more powerful Macbook Pro and he could play the game smoothly on medium settings and not on high. However, the performance on my PC has improved greatly since purchasing the game. At purchase, I played on high settings and in return my computer was loud, I wasn't able to sustain a stable FPS, and the game took up 16% of my CPU and up to 400mb of memory, per my task manager. Now, my computer does not run loud and I can sustain a solid 55-60FPS. Per my task manager, the game takes up 13% CPU and 350mb of memory and while not a great improvement, it is still an improvement nonetheless. Overall, while the game continues to perform better, much more improvement is needed.As I stated prior, the game features an abundance of issues. However, Blacklight have been effective at improving the game and removing bugs. And, I have made a regular contribution to the Golf With Your Friends forums on the issues I encountered as I do want to help them fix the game and succeed. At purchase, my main issues with the game were the physics and the lag that came with it. For instance, the majority of shots in courses would be overrun by lag and glitches in the physics of putting the ball. Currently, the game has made noticeable improvements in both areas but do occasionally occur.Overall, Golf With Your Friends is a solid Early Access title that is best played with friends to maximise your entertainment. It incorporates the simple feature of golf and this basic idea has been successful through the three well designed maps that are in different landscapes. It contains an excellent development team that listens to the community and wants to drastically improve this game. As with any Early Access title, it does have its fair share of bugs, but the development team has ironed out the main issues and is constantly improving this game with regular patches. This game is incredibly cheap at $5.99 and therefore if you have friends to play with I highly recommend this game because it's fun. If you intend to play solo, quite frankly it is your choice because it may get boring but at $6, nothing can go wrong.Note, for an Early Access title I won't do a ratings score.If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group Antwog's Analysis (Reviews). I also write reviews for TeamTom's Reviews.

Early Access Review
Golf with you friends review.Pros:+ Excellent developers. + Many customization options.+ Provides hours of entertainment.+ Fairly inexpensive.+ Amazing courses.+ Consistent updates.Cons:- May feel repetitive.- No dedicated matchmaking.- Requires others for maximum enjoyment.MultiplayerOnline multiplayer is becoming an increasingly important factor in my decision to purchase games. With that said, I feel multiplayer in this game is rather lacking. Golf with your friends doesn't provide a dedicated matchmaking system. It does, however, grant you the option to create custom lobbies effortlessly.SummaryOverall, Golf With Your Friends is a solid game that is best played with others to maximize your entertainment. It contains an excellent development team that listens to the community and wants to improve the game drastically. The game is incredibly inexpensive at $5.99, and therefore if you have others to play with, I would highly recommend this game because it's quite enjoyable. If you intend to play solo, it may get repetitive fairly quickly, but is fantastic nonetheless.General : 8.5/10

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
Early Access Review
Picked up a random game to enjoy with my friends, but quickly found out that this is not the game to maintain those friendships.---------------------------------------------------------Do you like sports games? Challenges with friends? Do you value your friendship? Don't want to ruin it? What about golf?Yes, I said it. Golf. Despite being one of the most boring sports in the world - in my opinion, of course - Golf With Your Friends manages to create a fun, entertaining, competitive, and challenging atmosphere for all to enjoy.Progress through a series of holes (waves) while keeping in my mind that you must clock in the least amount of strokes. Risk it all - just your friends that is - in this great little game that can be played with the whole family; what are you waiting for?!---------------------------------------------------------Pros+ Believable physics+ Collisions with friends!+ Multiplayer mode is always great!+ Tons of customisation options available+ Different maps offer various amounts of challenges+ Manages to make golfing fun, and that's hard for someone like me+ Cheesy music that doesn't take away from the overall gameplay in any way+ Simple gameplay and very easy to play/understand (no crazy interafaces or controls to master)+ Ability to customise your golf ball: choose from many options in order to stand out from your friends+ Great price for the amount of content it currently offers (I picked it up at $4,79 on Steam); I would consider it a steal since you will be receiving more content later on in the future+ Active community = best news for a gamer (according to SteamCharts, there are 1,055 players playing now, with an all-time peak of 2,011. As this game continues to grow, I definitely see it becoming one of those games that people must have)Neutral± Ability to be competitive, but you risk your friendships should you emerge victorious± Some feautures that I think will be great but are not yet released: level editor and in-game currency that can be spent to customise your profile further. Will update this review when those are releasedCons- No controller support- Camera view spazzes out at times and this can get a bit annoying, especially when you're shooting and you get "locked in" to a bad angle- If you're prone to seizures, then be careful on the Oasis map. I think it's the 7th hole (I can't recall), but my golf ball got stuck underneath a pipe and my screen started spazzing out- Hard to get into a game with friends at the moment. The developer's said that they would work on this feature, but for now, it's annoying having to go through pages of lobby room's in order to find the one you want to join- Would be cool if the ball's could interact. Okay, this just sounds wrong, but what I mean is that if I were to hit my golf ball a certain way as my friend, then they would bounce off one another. This would increase the competitive value of the game by a lot I have been informed otherwise (thanks to Ian07)!---------------------------------------------------------This game is in Early Access mode, but seems quite well rounded for the amount of product offered. The company, Blacklight Interactive is made up of 3 people who appear to be truly dedicated to the game. It doesn't get any better than that.If you have a few bucks to spare, I definitely recommend this title. While you will have some raging moments, ultimately, you will have great memories with friends overall (and with new ones that you will make along the way). Give this game a try: you really won't regret it!Overall8.5/10---------------------------------------------------------Like my review or have any questions? Then please consider joining my review group, the Sonny Report! I will keep it up to date with the games that I plan on reviewing and will also accept suggestions.Whilst not a video review, if you would like to watch gameplay of Golf With Your Friends, then you can check mines out here. Cheers!

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								UPDATE: They have changed the name to Golf With Your Friends, due to what i believe to be a copyright issuea, as expected the flamers have started up already. Please note that the name change does not affect how the game plays. fs.First of all, with only 2 courses, this game ranks in my top 5 for price paid per hour of gameplay at 0.41c per hour, compared to rocket league (058.c) Euro Truck Sim 2 (0.63c) Civ 5 (1.24$) etc. for the amount of gameplay you get, its so worth the money.This is the best mini golf game on steam already, only 3 months in to EA.The two man dev team are passionately active on the forums, always taking into consideration what the community would like to see, they patch and fix bugs within hours (Most of the time) and are working really hard to make GWF a game that the community wants.As for the gameplay, its terribly easy to point your aim and take a shot, but the difficulty comes from choosing the right power and path to the hole. If you play in a big enough lobby there is bound to be someone who is great at the game, who will be more than willing to teach you a trick or two!With workshop support and new maps/reward system and skins coming soon you'll want to get on board straight away!All in all a great little time consuming, semi-competitive mini golf game with boundless creativity that shows great promise if (like the community believes) the developers stay as passionate as they are already.9/10

content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a very fun game to play with friends. It is definitely worth it for the low price tag even though there is not much content at the moment (more is on the way). MapsThe two maps that currently come with the game are very replayable and I have not noticed many bugs in them at all so far. One of them is called Forest and the other Oasis. At the moment Forest contains less bugs than Oasis which contains a few minor ones. MultiplayerThe mulitplayer lacks players but it is very easy to create your own server and you can play with up to 12 people. Joining servers is not as easy though as you have to go through a list of about 12 pages. A search tool would make this much easier. CustomisationCustomisation is also available in the game with the ability to change the colour of the ball. As well as this, you can customise your server settings to change the way you play the game. For example, you can change the shape of the balls to eggs and add an ability to jump whilst playing. Graphics 7/10Replayability 9/10Bugs 7/10Multiplayer 8/10Overall 7.75/10In my opinion this game is definitely worth a try and I think it is the best mini golf game out there.

content:
Posted: March 24
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Surpsingly this is a pretty fun game, especially with friends. I thought it would contain typical mini golf maps but it's a lot more creative/unique than that. I never knew how intense a game of golf with friends could be until I played this. The game makes things a lot more interesting by adding custom settings, such as changing the shape of the ball, or decreasing gravity. I would definitely recommend this game. There are a few bugs here and there but nothing game changing. Unfortunately the only thing I can say that's negative is that it's not really worth $6 for only 4 maps and this game unexpectedly makes my computer very loud for a simple golf game. I understand that it's an early access game and so, I look forward to the many additions the developers will bring to the game.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
Early Access Review
Golf With Your FriendsNote: Each field is weighted differently, and thus affects the overall score differently.  Field Rating Review   Graphics 7 Nothing spectacular, but this is a mini-golf game we're talking about here. It gets the job done rather well.   Gameplay 8 You would think mini-golf could only go so far with its options. Oh how wrong you would be. Lower gravity, increase bounce, change the ball shape (cube, triangle, etc), turn on collision, and more. Though there are currently only three courses, expect many more, and in the mean time enjoy what there is to offer. A couple downsides to the current gameplay: It can be quite glitchy at times, particular when trying to putt into the hole. The method for hitting the ball could also use some work, as it occasionally triggers false-positives and you hit the ball when you didn't mean to.   Story N/A Just the ridiculous moments you'll laugh about over and over with friends.   Multiplayer 10 It has been a couple years since a game made me laugh this hard, this consistently, while playing with my friends. From watching them fail easy shots in hilarious ways, to hearing them cry out as their ball flies off the course, you'll find plenty of good times in this simple mini-golf game. The laughs kick up a notch once low-gravity and high bounce are enabled.   Replayability 7 In its current state, there aren't quite enough levels to keep you occupied for a significantly long period of time. But what is there will keep you coming back to try different modes with various friends.   Overall 7.8/10 With the promise of more to come, Golf With Your Friends already has a fantastic start. With three levels that have 18 holes each, and a surprisingly amount of customization in gameplay, it is the best mini-golf game I have encountered yet. For the price range, highly recommended if you want a few nights of laughs with your friends. If you liked this review, feel free to check out my curator page:The TipsterYou are also welcome to join our group and play/discuss games together, here:  The Tipster

content:
Posted: January 12
Early Access Review
								Golf with your friends is one of the best, if not the best, mini golf game you can find here on Steam (and most places for that matter). It's pretty self-explained what the game is about, you play golf, with or without your friends. (Though playing with friends will give you an overall better experience, and if not, you need new friends).The game currently has four maps with a fifth one on the horizon, all of which has a different theme, you got your standard green forest type of map, a map set in the ancient Egypt, a map taking place in a enchanted magical forest, one in a haunted mansion and the fifth and upcoming one (as of this review) will feature a candyland sort of theme from my knowledge.The game does get somewhat repetitive after a few hours of gameplay once you figure out how every hole works and how to do well on them. This is a problem especially if you're playing multiplayer with strangers, and certain friends (Damn it Carl) since there is a handful of guides on Steam explaining how to get a hole-in-one or the best possible score on each hole, so more often than not you will play against someone who has memorized all the holes or just simply looking at a guide as they play.But there are a few settings you can play around with to spice things up incase you get bored such as: bigger golf balls, enable jumping (which makes the game way easier but is really enjoyable at the same time), enable gravity and so on.I haven't experienced any game-breaking bugs myself but the game is in Early Access so chances are there are a few bugs and glitches here and there that needs to be eliminated, aswell as more content being added in the future.For $6 this game is defenitely worth picking up, and you're able to get it for less during sales. And since it's not very expensive you can most likely talk some friends into buying it, or perhaps you can be generous and gift a copy to them. Very fun and enjoyable game to play casually!

Early Access Review



YouTube™ Video: Golf with your Friends Preview (Steam/PC) 

			Views: 691		

			In this video, we show a preview of the upcoming game ‘Golf with your Friends’ for Steam. Video was Recorded and Voiced by The Hidden Levels one and only Manic Ado.		

Golf with friends is a mini-golf game in which revolves around playing online against other people. You can play single player for now but they soon plan to add in AI Enemies. I feel this game has a super amount of potential and will be very fun. Positives:+ Music - Awesome soundtrack which makes me happy+ Variety - The golf courses are real fun to play, they plan to add 6 in total but only have two on there for now. + Very cheap price – For the price of the game I feel it’s most definitely worth it. Even with just these two courses.Negatives:- Not a lot of content yet (but that’s obvious as it’s in Early Access and runs risk of never being completed)- There is no real set difficulties to the courses. Would be nice for an Easy Course, Medium Course and Very Hard course instead of progressive which I get stuck on towards the end. I’m a novice! ;)- The game gets a bit rugged in the desert area and doesn’t run as smooth as the grasslands.I had a refreshing time playing Golf with Friends, my only regret is that I have no friends. (joke) I didn’t manage to test out the online section which would probably increase the games fun tenfold. I highly enjoyed single  player and practising on the courses which progressed from Easy to real difficult. I definitely recommend a purchase though and highly believe in the developers with following through, they are super friendly people and we talk often! We will see in time though! :) I believe in them!Score: Buy Now

number of helpful: 17 of 18 people (94%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Is there anything more sublime than a round of minigolf with your buddies? Some of my fondest childhood memories were of birthday parties at the putt-putt course, and even as an adult I sometimes cajole my co-workers into a round or two. Like the name suggests, Golf With Your Friends aims to capture that same simple joy, and does so with admittedly very few frills thus far.At the moment there are three courses to choose from, Forest, Oasis, and Twilight, at 18 holes apiece. Forest hews closest to what you remember of minigolf, with the classic windmill, Plinko drop, and river jump holes. Oasis is an Egyptian-themed course with longer, more elaborate holes that cross over and send the ball flying through the clear desert sky. Twilight is by far the hardest course, with unforgiving ramps and pits that might require half a dozen or more strokes to get just right.Navigating these courses is as easy as click, drag, and release. Your mouse aims your shot and you pull back to fill the four-part power bar, which gives you a wide range of control over the ball. Everything from feather-light taps to line drives are possible, and the holes you encounter will require them all. There's definitely a learning curve to the courses but most of the challenge is in learning just the right finesse to put on the ball to overcome the traps. I was coming close to par on all three courses after a single practice game on each, and I don't consider myself a putt-putt savant.The interface is simple enough to get you into a game almost immediately. Since this golf is intended to be enjoyed with (your) friends, every game is set up as a hosted server. Choosing to join gives you a handy browser with all the filters you could want, and hosting plops you down with name, password, and custom game options. One nice touch is that the lobby itself is a practice hole where you can putt around different obstacles while waiting for the match proper.Admittedly, three courses is not a lot to run with but the custom game options I mentioned give the game plenty more lasting power. You can switch on ball collisions with other players, low gravity mode, optional ball jumping, and even non-spherical balls. Custom games were popular from what I've seen among the thousand or so people playing at any given time, so be prepared for anything when you join a server. The player base seems pretty chill as well and it's always easy to find a match, even if it's not necessarily the course or options I might want at the moment.The graphics are serviceable but nothing spectacular, and the sound design is basic effects under some pleasantly peppy music. Obviously you're going to have more fun if you have the titular Your Friends to play with, but even going in solo there's plenty of fun to be had. Even in its early state, Golf With Your Friends contains enough simple fun to make it worth your time.

Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is exactly what you would expect from the title: Play some miniature golf!  Invite your friends!The music is relaxing, the sound effects are genuine, and the game has been a light-hearted laugh across voice with friends. That may seem like a small sample size, but it represents twenty or so total full plays across the game's current four courses.  As it is, it feels already in a state every bit worth the five-dollar price tag.  Go golf with your friends!

content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf with your Friends is an incredibly fun little game. The courses are creatively designed, challenging, aesthetically pleasing, and fun to play. The game currently has four 18-hole courses with two more expected to be developed before GwyF leaves Early Access. There are plenty of modifiers to increase the replayabilitly, especially when playing with friends, such as ball shape, ball size, gravity, bounciness, and collisions. Playing with the feature to jump the ball at will drastically changes how the courses need to be played.I can't really comment on playing the game solo, since I always play with friends, but it's a blast to play with a group over voice chat. GwyF has a text chat in-game if you cannot voice chat.GwyF is still in Early Access, and as such, has its share of issues. There are various bugs on some of the courses that involve clipping, going out of bounds, or getting stuck, especially when playing with different ball shapes; however, the devs have been keen on making sure those bugs are corrected. The spectator mode needs work. Some of the holes are flat-unplayable with certain ball shapes. It can also be somewhat of a pain to find your friends' lobby since there's no feature to invite from Steam. Most of these issues aren't necessarily game-breaking, and they normally come out to be hilarious and quirky at best, and mildly irritating at worst.All in all, GwyF is well worth its low price. It's simple, well designed, fun, and has a good amount of content, with more on the way.

content:
Posted: March 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a very quirky fun take on mini-golf that you play with your friends, strangers or even by your lonesome (trying to figure out the hole-in-one strats, you know who you are.) Currently has 2 courses available with more planned on the way, a few quirky modes currently on the experimental version and possibly some of the best devs I've experienced despite only being a 2 man team. They are very active on updates and have a roadmap in the forums if you want to see where they plan on taking it. They are very friendly and active on the forums and is taking community ideas and advice to make the game even better while also adding more to it in a fast enough manner.I highly recommend this to someone who wants a game that is more casual but has the options to make it a stressful race to the hole against others. There are plenty of Youtubers that have videos on it though they might be dated because of the constant tweaks by the devs but you can get an idea of what you'd be getting into from the videos, still though I think it's worth the price in it's current version with only 2 courses so when everything else eventually comes out it'll be more than cost efficient! :)

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								Decent fun, reminiscent of the old top-down mini golf flash games we all played in middle school during computer lab. Graphics look great. Needs some more gameplay options, which I'm sure that the developers are working on. Turn-based would add more pressure to each shot, for example. $6 is more than worth it for the fun you're going to get out of the two 18-hole courses (a forest and an egyptian temple-themed one). Perhaps I'm greedy, but I want more! I'll happily shell out a few more bucks if need be for some DLC courses; just don't get carried away! Awesome little time killer and a game that any kind of friend can enjoy with you. 8/10 as of early access. More modes, possibly more courses as well plz!

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								1st off going in, dont expect any sort of seriousness. When they added ball shapes: Cube, I knew the devs were pretty funny. But then came the Isosphere. An abomination, The physical form of RNGesus himself. You must offer a sacrifice to win his favor, may it be hitting an opponent off the course, or perhaps your own sanity. Anything goes, might be a simple shot. Until RNGesus says "Naw bro not feeling it." And if theres low gravity? Forget ever hoping on getting near the hole. Best indie game ive played for sometime, can't wait to see what else the devs can think of.

Early Access Review
A brief story of improvementOne of our friends knew about the game from Youtube(?) and was trying to convince us to buy it. We refused as it looked like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game so he bought 4 copies for everyone and our lifes changed. After that, we started spreading the word trying to convince more friends to buy it but they refused so we bought it for them and know we can finally live in a better world...Actual review"Golf With Your Friends""With Your Friends""Your Friends""Friends"If you have at least one, this is gonna be one of the best buys you can do.Simple, easy to understand and, over anything else, one of the funniest games you will ever play. As I'm writing this, there are three maps and the craziest thing you can do is allow jumps and change gravity, and we've been playing for the last ~week almost every night.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf with friends is a thrilling adventure in the dynamic genre of competitive mini - golf gaming.  It offers many opportunities to customize the gaming experience such as a dynamic range of ball color selections and endless options for colorful room naming. The in game chat features encourages the play to cheer your opponent on and celebrate great shots in a supportive community environment.  I find it easy to join a public game during times that my friends are unavailable--thus giving me the opportunity to make new friends with whom to share this exhilarating golfing experience.  I cannot recommend this game more highly for those who value beautifully designed games of skill within a fun and relaxing community environment.

								Absolutely fun game and an all around chill experience that is a great refresher. Is a fantastic game to play with friends, particularly as a drinking party game. In my opinion, the game is much less enjoyable by yourself and as the title suggests it is meant to be played with others. Granted that the game is in early access, I've run into a solid amount of bugs and complete game crashes. The last hole of the Oasis course is almost completely luck based and needs to be tweaked, but otherwise is a very balanced, relaxed, skill based game.Absolutely worth $5, you won't regret it.

								Seriously, buy this game. It's so much more fun than I expected it to be, and I had super high hopes as it was because it's Minigolf and I really like minigolf. number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 17
Early Access Review
								Great game. I think the title alone will help you decide if you'll like it. Do you want to golf with your friends?? Well if that sounds good, you should probably enjoy it. The Level design here has its flaws at times, (mainly with holes that forces you to hit your ball off walls, like the pillars in egypt or the bottle in the mansion) but it is for the most part quite forgiving and interesting. It's great for a large group of friends of all skill levels. The controls themselves are incredibly simple but very well made. Simply click and drag where you want to go and how hard you want to hit it. There's a power bar that easily indicates how hard or soft you'll be hitting. It gets the job done efficiently, and I appreciate that. Surprisingly, it is also got a great amount of replay ability. Coming back to maps you did and turning on jump can really change the entire game. It's broken, but it's fun. And if you really want to make things hectic, you can change the gravity, change the ball shape to all sorts of horrible things (Eggs, cones, stars, cubes, etc) which all completely change how the holes work. Luckily, they're still almost all doable! I really enjoy this game for its simplicity. It's what you'd expect from a mini golf game. I wouldn't recommend it unless you bring a few friends along, however. The single player is nice, but would probably get stale. Only real gripes right now are that I wish there were more levels and possibly a VERY easy to use level editor that lets you pick community levels on the fly (similar to how SpeedRunners does it). Obviously, though, there's more planned for the game, but you can never be sure when it comes to Early Access. Even though there's only a handful of maps, I'd strongly recommend this game with friends, especially since the price is quite affordable as well.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've had more time to play now so I can give a more thorough review.TLDR: Amazing game to play with friends at a great low price.Pros:Each course lasts around a half hour, so your games aren't dragged out.Simple controls. All you have to do is hold the left click and pull back the mouse.Runs great on most computersThere's a ton more pros but you guys get the idea.Cons:Not a lot of players. Game came out Janurary 30th and didn't get featured on the front page of Steam, so it might be awhile before the playerbase gets heavier.Only two courses, 18 holes each. They are currently working on some other courses and the potential of a content creator added.Some glitches. Just about all non game breaking.---As you can see there are tons of reasons to by this game, the big one being it's not like other horrible early access games that are just buggy messes. It's $6, definitely worth it.Make sure to check out the subreddit!https://www.reddit.com/r/GolfWithFriendsGame

Early Access Review
								Still one of the few best Indie / early access games out there to play with a full party of 5 or 6 friends. The only problem I have with this game is that you can't ivite friends to a lobby, so your friends have to find your lobby. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Totally awesome game for stupidly cheap fun!Graphics: The graphics are not amazing.  Seriously they are basic and offer nothing amazing, but graphics do not make  a game enjoyable and for this game, the graphics are decent enough to not be bothered by!Audio:  The audio again is simple.  It is mini golf but has some kinda annoying music, which you just turn off but for the sound itself it again is nothing enjoyable.  Just basic.Controls: The controls are simple mouse to use, so easy you learn the game on the first few seconds and cannot complain about it at all.Gameplay: The gameplay is mini golf basically... What do you want? You can turn normal minigolf into some insane fun with friends... Up too 12 people might I add and there are several options you can change in the modes options to make the game even more enjoyable, which range from low low gravity, different balls like egg shape, cube shape, cyclinder shape and so on, so mix all these together and you've got a lot of fun going for you!Right now as I write this review, there are only 3 zones and each zone contains roughly 19 holes each.  Sadly, you can do these in under an hour, depending on the settings you have! Still the game is insanely cheap and will be getting a lot of work and more content in the mix and for that, I would highly highly recommend the game!So yes, go and buy!

Early Access Review
								I super fun golf game, and let me tell you, if you get like 2-3 of your good friends together and play this, you will have a jolly good time! I absolutely love this game and I've only played an hours worth. The courses offer a bit of difficulty that requires you to time your shots right and use your pro strats. It would be really nice if that added more than 6 levels once it's done because you can play through the levels fairly quickly. The other downside is that the balls appear to "lag" when you are spectating and there are also a few spots on different holes where the ball can get stuck and there is no way to get it unstuck.All in all. A really fun game that I would definently recommend buying if you have an extra $6.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Basically, if you've got some friends, you'll probably get the most fun out of this game, even if there's only 2 courses available right now. Theres a few custom options to keep the game interesting, different golf ball shapes, altering gravity, jumping, and how bouncy the ground is, to name a few. If you play with the original options, you most likely won't run into any game breaking bugs, however some of the options when customized, may lead to a few holes that are extremely hard. Runs smooth on an Intel HD 4400 integrated gpu on low, at least, smooth enough for me to be able to enjoy it. If you dont have friends, there's still enough games on around 7-9 pm EST in the NA region, I can't say I've seen the list empty, however I usually get on later in the day to play.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								"My mum always said life is better with friends. I didn't believe her. Now I wish I had more friends."Golf and Early access, for most, will turn you away. However the real kicker in this title is "with your friends" if you've made any up to this point in your life. This game will wish you had. IT is purely a social experienced that is there to kill a bit of time, record something stupid and love every second. There will be disbelief and rage amongst chaos and humor.Golf, well... it's golf. Think putt-putt in a blender. Can be slow on standard, or hectic with different shaped balls or even cubes and that is not mentioning the jumping.Early access. The game holds up well with it's biggest flaw being a lack of content. When I purchased it, there were only three different "maps" that housed a full course of 18 holes. To my knowledge now, there is 4 maps. I would say there really need to be a significant jump in content before I call it a completed game.Overall I would vote it a 7/10 for what it is, an early access golf game. To be honest when a mate said buy it I was skeptical. It will serve you well with friends and bore you to death alone and I can't wait for more conent.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								At the time of writing, Golf With Your Friends is still in Early Access, but having been on the market since January 30th, I’m pretty comfortable in my assumption that nothing ground-breaking is going to come out of the game, and that it’s at a point where GWYF can be reviewed for the long-term.Golf With Your Friends is one of those stunningly aptly named games that despite its simplicity, still manages to imbue the game with a sense of fun before you even get to playing it. I’m really lucky when it comes to reviewing this game, because the 8-Bit Preppers crew all grabbed a copy one night to play together, and I feel as though that initial session really let GWYF show us exactly what it was all about. There were tears of laughter, no small amount of sledging, and cries of “♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t” as we played through the three maps that were available. It was an excellent initial experience, and we have managed to wring a few more sessions out of it by changing the physics options, and by joining public games, but in the end GWYF faces the same dilemma that many early access multiplayers face: Content.In the ten months since its release, Blacklight Interactive has added one extra course to Golf With Your Friends. One. It fills me with disappointment to think of how popular this game could have been upon release if it had more courses, or if more courses were released in a timely manner over the duration of the Early Access period. Like most simple games of skill, GWYF has the potential to be one of those excellent casual games that never gets uninstalled. There are great variations in the four courses that are available at this stage, and I am genuinely interested to see what the next two courses that are scheduled for release in the “full game” will look like. I am, however, pretty sceptical that they will be released before mid 2017, considering the fourth map took so long to release. If Blacklight Interactive really wanted to ensure the longevity of GWYF, release of a level editor with the full game would go a long way towards that.I have to admit that on a fundamental level I still think that releasing games before they are finished is an affront to consumers, but at the same time I can also appreciate its benefits for fledgling Developers like Blacklight Interactive. The good news is that in Golf With Your Friends, they have set very reasonable targets for what is going to be included in the full game. I just wonder if without a level editor or something that adds value and replayability, whether this will just be another casual multiplayer picked up on sale for the majority of consumers. My advice is to plan a game session with your mates, and milk every bit of enjoyment you can from that initial gameplay.

content:

Early Access Review
								Well, I bought this game thinking, "Hmmmm, online mini golf for 6 bucks? Not a bad deal." Ohhhhh what a mistake that was. This game has driven me to insanity, who knew a game of mini golf could make you want to hurt someone who lives across the planet and give you PTSD every time you try and eat an ice cream CONE. Stupid cone. When all the modifiers are off, the game can be enjoyable, but when they're on all hell breaks loose. I know it's in alpha but the game is quite buggy, this will hopefully be worked out. I tried to get a refund, but Steam said 3 hours was TOO much gameplay, so I guess I'm stuck getting infuriated by cones and collisions with other players.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tl;DR: Buy it. Pros- Fun and balanced gameplay, perfect mix of everything- Playing against friends is great and rage inducing- Textures look great and it runs well- Active mods who are open to hearing about ideas and bugs- Good course design- Modifiers add a new twist to the game that can be niceCons - Only 2 courses. More to come soon so not really a con.- Music isn't fitting on the Oasis course, is apparently getting changed soon- Chat is in upper case only which isn't that big of a dealOverall It is an above average game. It was only $6.50CAD which is a steal at the moment. Friends and I have over 10 hours each and the game isn't even halfway made yet. With a possible level editor coming this game is a must buy for any steam user. Rating based on price: 9.5/10

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								For an early access game, with little to no content... I have never had so much fun playing a video game in YEARS now, Golf with Friends is easily the funnest thing I have ever done.The game itself is extremely well polished for early access, if they didn't say on the store page, they could have easily sold this as a full release and nobody would question it, even with only two courses (18 holes each) it's so well done.The music is very happy sounding, and quite addicting, it repeats on a loop basically forever... But you don't even notice it, even on a loop it's just that fitting to the game.  I could listen to this on a daily basis and still love it.The physics of the game are almost flawless, with a little skill you can predict exactly where the ball will go, and sink that hole in one every time.The courses, for there only being two... Are beautifully designed, with the classics such as windmills... All the way to being eaten by a sphinx, going throughout it's body, and being launched out into a temple of doom.You've also got loops, half pipes, bouncing platforms that launch your ball all over, bank shots off pillars, running along the walls, fake holes that launch you off the course. They've got it all!It's a lot of fun playing singleplayer, sadly there are no AI so you're all alone, but it's decent fun.But once you add even a single friend to the game... Oh boy, get ready for one hell of a time! The more you add, the more fun it is.  Exponentially more fun, when on Skype or other method of talking to your other players.The dev team for this game is very small, only two people, but they are extremely active in the community discussions, taking suggestions, helping with issues, and are just providing an outstanding experience for their users. 10/10 game, 15/10 devs.

								You wouldn't expect a person who plays GTA V constantly to like an indie mini golf game but I believe it holds a lot of potential. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's minigolf. Not that hard to do, really. You probably already knew that from the title of the game.It's currently in early access (Feb. 23, 2016) so there's not a whole lot of everything yet, but what's there now is polished and fun. More courses are promised, along with a level creator, so there should be tons of replayability in the future.Also, the devs are super active in responding to community feedback. Moreso than I've seen for most indie developers, or game devs in general. They are extremely passionate about their game and don't want anyone to be left out due to a small glitch that doesn't allow them to play.If you don't like minigolf, though, there's nothing here for you. If you don't like minigolf, however, chances are you would not be reading reviews for a minigolf game.I'd rate it8/10Get it now before, the price goes up (if it ever does) later in development, and also to support the devs to finish this. I might rate higher if/when new content is released and is subsequently good.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								In it's Early Access state it's a great game for short intervals. Especially if you have friends that don't like the same genre as you do - because everybody knows how to play and enjoys some virtual golf. And if you want it to become crazy fun, just enable ball-jumping and bouncy underground in "Custom" mode and let everybody get creative with their snipes and slam dunks. xD Maybe even add low gravity to the mix. Or play legit minigolf physics in "Classic" mode. All of that you can do in the Early Access build and the two maps are really rich with basic but very diverse courses in two clearly divided difficulty levels where Forest is "Easy" and Oasis is "Advanced". And don't fear 12 player games, you can turn player collision off if you so desire.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf games are boring. Admit it. But what about a golf game where your ball is a sqaure and you can shoot your square at your friend and send them off the course, making them start over? Now that's a fun golf game. In this game, yes, you play golf with (Big Surprise) your friends. And yes, you can play an average game. But why not spice up the settings? Why not play golf with eggs? Why not turn jump on and watch golf balls jump around the course? Why not both? This game is honestly fun with some good friends, and can make some good laughs.Over all? 7/10 (With some friends)

content:
Posted: February 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf with friends is easily one of the most fun games I've played in a while. It's just pure and simple fun.At the moment, there are only two courses, the Forest (self explanatory) and Oasis, which is an egyptian themed course. The lack of other courses hasn't turned me off from the game, however. The levels are very repeatable and fun, and it's always interesting to try to find inventive ways to get a better score on a certain hole. In the future they will be adding more courses, so if the lack of courses is a turn off for you, it will soon be fixed. One thing I would really like to see in this game is a course creator, so that the community can make their own courses. Overall, I highly recommend this game. It's great, simple fun and for only $6, that's an awesome deal.

								(Written as of 29 of March, 2016, Update 0.0.8H1)This game is already so much fun, and with more levels on the way, it's gonna get even better. The only thing I'd say is missing so far is Workshop support, or at least the ability for players to create and share custom made maps. With the different types of objects you can use to get to the end of the course, the game is either really easy, or really tough. But still really fun.Just grab a couple of friends (or just let random people join you) and go wild. It's only just come out a couple of months ago, but it's got a lot of potential and future content on the way. Recommended for sure. Cones are hard to golf with.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								In it's Early Access state it's a great game for short intervals. Especially if you have friends that don't like the same genre as you do - because everybody knows how to play and enjoys some virtual golf. And if you want it to become crazy fun, just enable ball-jumping and bouncy underground in "Custom" mode and let everybody get creative with their snipes and slam dunks. xD Maybe even add low gravity to the mix. Or play legit minigolf physics in "Classic" mode. All of that you can do in the Early Access build and the two maps are really rich with basic but very diverse courses in two clearly divided difficulty levels where Forest is "Easy" and Oasis is "Advanced". And don't fear 12 player games, you can turn player collision off if you so desire.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf with friends is easily one of the most fun games I've played in a while. It's just pure and simple fun.At the moment, there are only two courses, the Forest (self explanatory) and Oasis, which is an egyptian themed course. The lack of other courses hasn't turned me off from the game, however. The levels are very repeatable and fun, and it's always interesting to try to find inventive ways to get a better score on a certain hole. In the future they will be adding more courses, so if the lack of courses is a turn off for you, it will soon be fixed. One thing I would really like to see in this game is a course creator, so that the community can make their own courses. Overall, I highly recommend this game. It's great, simple fun and for only $6, that's an awesome deal.

content:
Posted: April 5, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is really a fun game. Due to it being early access at the moment, you might have a limited experience, but fun none the less. It's a fantastic game to play with your friends (I suggest being on voice comms with them, it's really funny).I feel that I can't explain it better than "it's good fun", so here's a list of good and lacking aspects of this game that I have come across in my 7 hours of playtime:Good:- Very easy to pick up and play.  Within 30 minutes of starting the game I was already able to play on a decent competitive level against others.- The controls are wonderful. Feels very smooth when you play it and it doesn't take long for you to master the ways of the putt-putt.- Stimulating/satisfying gameplay; this is the kind of game I just love to play while watching a movie or YouTube on my second monitor.- Playing together with friends is alot of fun and depending on how you customize the game rules, you can get some proper Mario Kart-esque competitive fun.Lacking:- As of posting this, there are only 2 maps; Forest and Oasis. There is a big shift in difficulty between the two. Forest is very easy and the pars/hole-in-ones can be memorized within an hour, while Oasis is very tricky and requires alot of good timing. This will no doubt be no issue once more maps have been added.- I have experienced a few weird occurrences regarding the physics of the game. Sometimes when you hit a wall straight on, your ball can bounce away at an angle. Sometimes you can suddenly go off a jump and go way higher than you usually do.- The server browser is probably the worst thing right now, as you cannot sort the listings in any way, and you have to painstakingly check if the server is in the Lobby and has no password requirements. A way to sort the server list and filter out password requiring servers would be awesome.Note: Even though there are these lacking aspects of the game, the good aspects override them most of the time.All in all, I'd say this game guarantees at least 3 hours of fun, and much more if you can get a few friends to play with.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								More like Trigger With Your Friends! This is a surprisingly fun minigolf game for up to 12 players, across three levels 18 holes each (at the time of writing this review), so there's a lot of minigolf to be had. It gets really tricky and fun when the host enables the ball jump, which means you can cut through holes in creative ways.Friendship is over when the host enables solid ball mode - you can knock your friend away back to square one if you're lucky.Also, all 12 players play the same hole at the same time, which speeds things up considerably.Although the game is in Early Access, all the important parts are working. Ball physics can be a little bit wonky when the players interact with each other, but it's still loads of fun.

content:
Posted: November 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Really fun game, I specially enjoy that you can customize each game with different options such as jumping, different ball shapes etc. One thing that I would love for the game developer to change in future patches, would be that there was an option (or make it default) for players to make every stroke hit before the timer runs out count. Let all balls finish rolling before you change to the next map. I have noticed that on multiplayer the timer isn't always 100% in sync between players, some players being able to hit strokers that seemed like they should have definetly been out of time on my end. All of my friends who have played the game agree with this. Despite this minor request, the game is cheap and definetly worth it. I'm looking forward to future updates and maps!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								"Hey, guys, we fixed the physics!" -- Not the phrase I would use. I was on the second hole of Oasis, and my ball stopped on the side of the bowl and just started this slow slide down towards the centre, turning what SHOULD have been a hole in one into a four-stroke before I retired from the match. This doesn't even get into the fact that my jumps are STILL not registering in parts of the Forest. I get that this is early access, and that we should expect bugs, but it seems like every patch that's being put out either breaks MORE stuff, or there's absolutely no change. It would be great if these little wrinkles are ironed out before full-release, but it seems like every "fix" just causes more problems than leaving it alone in the first place.Overall, it's a great game (Don't turn on collision, unless you want to cost yourself a friend or five). I'm still going to play it; please don't think otherwise. But this latest "patch" has more holes than Swiss Cheese.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								My friends and I have been looking for a good mini-golf game that is on par with Gmod Towers. This is finally the answer to our search. While this is early access, the current feature set, graphics, customization, and maps provide a very promising game. Very few glitches were encountered and the gameplay is smooth. Hosting a game and getting started was fast. I look forward to the level customization and steam workshop integration. If they achieve this feature, it will make this game well worth the price. Positives: - Well optimized game- Smooth gameplay and nice graphics- The 2 levels included were well designed- Private games- Customizable games ( low grav, ball types, etc)Negatives:- Early Access (Not feature complete)- No level editor/steam workshop yet. (This is a planned feature)

content:
Posted: April 9
Early Access Review
								I had a chance to play this game with my friend. He is my nephew. We played all the courses.  We had a lot of fun playing the game. We didnt have any disconnects. We didnt have any issues with the ball physics. We both played on laptops. He owns a AMD system and I have a Intel system. I turned off AA as it kills the frames per second. With AA I was getting under 30. Without I am at a steady 30fps. I am playing on a i3 5005u. This is still in EA so its still a little rough. The most glaring issue is no overhead view of the golf course your playing on. So sometimes your not sure where to hit the ball. I wouldnt mind a quick flyover the hole. Their is a free cam. You can bring this up with the C button.  I should mention that their is no controller support at this time. Their is no playing on the same screen side by side. Its online only for now.  I know they are going to add controller support eventually. So its mouse right now. I really liked the graphics. The sounds were good. The golf courses I found all of them to be fun.  Overall if you have a friend and want to play a game with him/her this would be a great choice. If you dont have friends then your going to have to try and get somone to play with you. The game is a lot of fun for the low price.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								Just get the game. Buy it. Right now. Just do it.This game is just amazing. I love it so very much, except there is one problem. I have no friends. Just Kidding. Well anyway, back to the review. You might think that you would easily get bored playing the same two courses over and over again, but no, there are customization options. There are so many combinations of custom options, such as jumping, low gravity, and even different shapes for balls. Many of these will majorly change the game. Even if you don't have friends, you can still host your own game and play by yourself. It also has a nice sound track.For an early access game, it is incredible. 10/10 Would hole in one then stole out on the next hole again.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								My Quick Look is below, if you want to read the written review click 'Read More'


YouTube™ Video: Phawx Plays Golf With Friends - MiniGolf Fun Times - Quick Look 

			Views: 90		

			Steam Store Link: http://store.steampowered.com/app/431240/		

Great mini-golf game.  Early Access is more about lack of content than stability.  My friend and I hit one bad bug in the time we played, but other than that the game is pretty solid.Right now the biggest draw back is that there are only two maps and only one mode (as of Jan 30th 2016), but as long as more content comes in this is shaping up to be an amazing minigolf game.The netcode seems to work without a hitch, but that might be more because that everyone plays their turn asynchronously without having to wait for anyone else.  So 8 player games will go just as fast as a 2-player game, skillset obviously affecting the time.My favorite golf games are Kirby's Dream Course and Tee It Up (XBLA) so I've always favored a more arcade type golf experience.Very interested to see what type of modes open up as the game progresses, like power-ups etc. Pros:+Pretty Stable for an *alpha* game+Online Multiplayer works great+Games are fast without much waiting+Auto Spectate after you've finished your hole+Level design for the first two maps are very coolCons:-Limited amount of content (which should be fixed provided that more maps and modes come)

Early Access Review
								RAGE!!! This game is full of it. But that's what makes it so fun! Sure there are several holes that are annoying and sometimes impossible. And that's a bit frustrating, but it's still really fun. Collisions with other players can be a bit annoying when your ball just randomly bounces back after you put into an open area. And hitbox issues on walls that cause your ball to bounce off-target. This game could use several updates to holes; higher walls for example.Overall, this is a fun game. At least for a few rounds.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								As a half black half asian golf professional who cheats on his wife regularly - I KNOW GOLF. This my friends is the ultimate expression of what the game of golf was always meant to be, in video game form. You will be taken to heaven in the luscious scenery of the "Forest" before falling to hell in the contradictory-named "Oasis". This game has been tailored for all the masochistic professional golfers of the world to devote their last bits of sanity to the glory of perfection. Also well suited for the beginner golfer setting out on his long journey from pallet town to collect all 8 gym badges and finally catch them all. There will be unprecidented adventures on an exploration of the Kanto region where you will meet friends and foes alike, on your way to finally realizing your dream of becomming a pokemon master. Gotta Catch em All! Pokemon!

Early Access Review
								I am enjoying this game! Definitely does need to be played with friends, though. Much sillier, especially with bounce and collision enabled. I will admit I started playing it because I saw YouTubers playing it.It does require an easier way to find your friends' game in the server list, but hopefully that will be added in development. It doesn't seem quite done yet, and has a few bugs, but the developer does seem very attentive on the forum.Only three courses at the moment, but a variety of amusing ways to mess with physics adds some replayability. Won't keep you entertained forever, but a fun thing to do for a round or two.

								Although I ran into a few weird OB issues where my ball wouldn't get reset, I had a great time playing this with some friends today (went through both courses twice with 3 and 4 players). Some classic holes mixed in with some truly devious ones! Those will have your under par score decimated in the blink of an eye! number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								The green flags of an Early Access game are usually the core gameplay mechanics and the developers track record. As it stands now, controls for this game are ergonomic and pleasurable to use. There are 4 levels and they are each pretty well constructed to mimic the idiosyncrasies of real life mini-golf. The lobby/multiplayer system is already in place, so you can (as the title says) Golf with your Friends!The developers are 3 guys based out of Australia with no prior track record. They have been promising so far with updates and addressing user concerns (via forums, emails, or Discord), but I always err on the side of caution since the income from an Early Access game can sometimes alter agendas; this is especially true for developers that have no investors and haven't had that sort of money before. Verdict: the game is great fun. You won't save much by waiting for it to go on sale. Potentially be ready for the developers to have a change of heart.

Early Access Review
								This game can be fun if you're alone - there is online multiplayer and even playing through the courses solo can be a blast. However, this game truly shines when it comes to - as the name suggests - playing local with your friends! The first time is a collective confusion of "Where is the hole?" which later devolves into a havoc of putting and flying! The additional settings can really spice up a game - frustration and laughter alike! Basically, if you can arrange for you and a couple of friends to all get this game together, I assure you it'll be worth every penny.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is quite bare bones at the moment, but what it lacks in features it makes up for in fun. Now, I can't speak for how it plays with strangers, however this is a great casual golf game to play with your friend(s) - as the title alludes to. Considering the content (or lack of), the price point is suitable (and perhaps even surprising at times). With three courses currently implemented, things can seem repetitive, though the ability to turn on modifiers ensures replayability.Despite the occasional frame drops, the game looks nice. There is also a fair amount of desync, but for now it's nothing that isn't to be expected given its Early Access state. Of course, one would hope for improvement in both the aforementioned areas as development progresses.A title hard to pass up at such a low price, so long as you have friends.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								First off, I would highly reccommend this game to anyone. This game is some of the most fun you can have in multiplayer games. You can also play singleplayer, but if you want to have fun, you really need a bunch of friends playing it with you. I would give this game a solid 9/10 on enjoyment. I can't judge how the game is built too much since it's currently only in version .096, a long while until fully complete. Visuals - 8/10A game doesn't have to be good to have good graphics. This game has graphics that are good enough. Looking at some games that run at 1080p 60fps for me such as some table pool ones, look fine, but don't fit the game. The graphics just don't fit the mood of the music or the game your actually playing. On Golf With Your Friends though, the graphics fit the game. The graphics go well with the music as well. The graphics don't cause the game to slowdown, even with my meh computer. I wouldn't change anything about how this game looks if I could.Music - 7/10Some of the tracks in this game can get a bit repetitive, but they are still pretty decent. The music fits great with not only the graphics, but the mood you'll be in while playing this game: happy. I'm going to end the music section quick just to save time, not too much to say about it.Singleplayer - 5/10I don't give this game a very high score for singleplayer. The game is still fun, but not nearly as fun as if you were playing with a bunch of friends. If you do have friends but they don't feel like playing at that moment, you can go mess around with 50 shots and level retries trying to find ways to get holes in ones though, and the courses alone are entertaining.Multiplayer - 9.5/10I think this game has a potential to make a 10/10 in this area, but again, it's not complete yet. Sitting down with my friends playing this game is one of my favorite things to do. Me and my friends even named each score (Hole in one, birdie, bogie, etc.) after Garfield characters, even calling running out of shots/time a "burnt lasagna". The amount of laughs I've gotten out of my friends failing, or just the tention of a friend being on the last level when you don't know who's going to win. Replay Value - 8/10This game has a lot of customizable features in the custom game settings. If you want, you can make the ball into an egg or a cube, you can turn on low gravity, high bounce, jumping, etc. You can customize your ball color if you want, but not that exciting. The devs have said that they plan to add minigames in the future. One suggestion someone had was that you would have to get the ball somewhere while in a pinball machine, or into a basketball hoop, which sounds amazingly fun. The dev commented on this idea saying he might impliment it, so you can already see that the creators are listening.Overall - 9/10 (for now)This indie game is amazingly fun, and I hope that all of you reading this review buy it right now and play it with some friends. There is a lot of hope for this game, and I can't wait  to see it thrive forward. This game is 100% worth the 6 dollars I payed for it, and I would probably but this game if it was 30 or 40 dollars, it is an amazing game, that again, I would reccomend to anyone. - Coddlington (me)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have never played this game as a straight up, real life mini golf experience. I think the game is meant to be played with low grav, bouncy ground, and especially with random ball shapes. I think you're missing out if you do not frustrate yourself and your friends to the point of friendship-ending rage that comes with this game. Conceptually, it's genius. I don't know who thought it would be a good idea to put a cone on a mini golf course, but it makes for an interesting game. As of right now, there are only three maps. But the game is still in early access, and I can forgive that because of the replay value that comes with this game, especially in multiplayer. There are so many ways to customize games that each game could have an entirely different spin.The lobbies are pretty annoying as of right now. You can't search a lobby name, so you have to flip through pages. Right now, that's not a huge problem since there are maybe 30 pages at max at any given time, but when this game becomes more popular, that's not gonna fly. Also, when typing in a password, you have to erase the word password before typing. It's something small but incredibly annoying after the first four or five times you do it. The option to create a lobby through Steam would be nice.I think the music kind of sucks, which is a little disappointing but not a dealbreaker. There is, however, one game-breaking bug I've encountered a few times where your golf ball begins to jump in place on its own without stopping. Sometimes it will stop when the turn is over, but sometimes it will just keep jumping forever and the only thing you can do to stop it is end the game. However, this is still an early access game and I've heard the developers are already on top of it.Overall, it's a great game, it's hilarious, and the bugs are being worked out. I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is a great mini-golf game, it may still be in very early access, but is still a lot of fun and would highly reccomend it to any and all players that like mini-golf.- Has a lot of gimmicks to make the game challenging, creative, and interesting.- Has three courses; Forest, Oasis, and Twilight, with a fourth and possibly more coming on its way.- Includes two game modes, Classic and Custom, which you can choose between depending on your style of play    - Classic is your basic style of mini-golf, you use your power and angle to get in the hole with the lowest score.    - Custom you can choose between a lot of different features, such as Ball Shape, Gravity, Bouncy Ground, Jumping, and a few others to make the game even crazier for the creative of golfers and to those who want to spice up a round of golf to balance the skill between experienced and inexperienced players.- One downside as of right now is that sometimes it can be a little hard to try and find the match your trying to join, but I'm sure the devs will put something in to make that easier at some point.

content:
Posted: February 25
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								At first I thought the game was just a traditional golfing game where there added a multiplayer mode to it but I was wrong that game is really fun to play with some friends like the name would suggest.So it is any good ?Disclaimer!The game being still in alpha at the time this review will maybe not be still relavent when the game will reach gold but it deserve a critic or two.The general idea :So the game takes place on one of a few golfing courses ,with all a different themes and mechanics, those golfing course are :-Forest-Oasis-Twilight-Haunted-CandylandAll the golfing courses has 18 holes ,each holes can be completed in multiple ways which it gives some replay value and a notion of experimenting in each playthrough .No Caption ProvidedMore in detail :You can customize your ball in which ever color you want.Create and join public or private lobby.Final thoughts :There is no much to say about this game because its still in developpement. The game is really fun for a Sunday afternoon with a group of friends online ,don't expect more from this title, it’s shame the game has not yet an editor it would give the game more replay value and would really bring more people to it and by consequence create a community around this fun indy game.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game can be fun if you're alone - there is online multiplayer and even playing through the courses solo can be a blast. However, this game truly shines when it comes to - as the name suggests - playing local with your friends! The first time is a collective confusion of "Where is the hole?" which later devolves into a havoc of putting and flying! The additional settings can really spice up a game - frustration and laughter alike! Basically, if you can arrange for you and a couple of friends to all get this game together, I assure you it'll be worth every penny.
