number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
Early Access Review
								The best mini-golf experience money can buy.Pros:Multiple courses, All unique and vary in difficultyGreat physics (semi customizable)Custom set rules/settings (max shots per hole, ball shape, size, color, "jump" option, gravity, it goes on...The settings gives it a lot of replayability You'll never have so much fun getting frustrated with your friendsCons:Some extreme settings can make some holes impossible. (putting a cone a few places in candyland LOL) Very few ramps/runways/general ground areas don't match up perfectly which results in little bumps to crazy physics bugs. I really have nothing bad to say about this game at all, and as soon as the game starts it gives you a warning that the game is in alpha, there are bugs, it is what it is. It's not as bad as the warning makes it seem, in my opinion. The first "Con" is really on you, not the game. When you change gravity, use weird shapes, and have to jump a slightly bumpy spiral ramp, and can't make it... welll... duh. lol. The second is totally understandable, it's in alpha, and they are so far and few, it's just another thing for you and your friends to laugh and cry about, just adding to the overall experience. 100% Worth it.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								Just bought this today for my friend and myself, and we played through each of the maps once, and already we can tell this is going to be a great game! I only have 1 issue with this game at present, and that's with the lack of mouse inversion, but given it's very early access, I totally understand not everything will be even close to perfect yet. (I've read this is being planned for future builds, so I can wait.)Paying under $5 for this at such an early stage, while being actively developed is worth every cent. The fact that it's as fun as it is in its current form, means I have zero regrets in purchasing! I haven't experienced any game breaking bugs yet or anything. It runs smooth at 2160p, and it had my friend and I laughting our asses off at many elements. (The little floaties on the ball.. LOL!) I rarely review games after only playing through for such a short amount of time, but I can't help myself with this one! I would happily encourage people to buy, as doing so will no doubt allow the dev to make this even better than it already is!Was fantastic to see an Australian region option already too! Much more fun than I've had with a lot of other mini golf games. Challenging and creative holes, and while there are only 3 levels at present, they each have 18 holes, so there's plenty with which to have fun! I can see my friend and I playing a lot more of this, especially if the dev continues to integrate suggestions made by players!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is an early access game first, and a golfing game second. It's always important to remember what you're getting with your games, and whether or not they're finished, and whether or not you're okay with an incomplete game. For the purpose of full disclosure, I'll be noting that I received this from a Humble Bundle that was gifted to me by a friend. I've put a couple of hours into GWYF now in various public lobbies, and I'll be playing with actual friends at some point soon now that I have a hang of the controls. This plays like a standard crazy golf game, with three courses of 18 holes each featuring insane and outlandish obstacles and physics conundrums to overcome. The courses are entertaining, though they can get somewhat repetitive in public lobbies, as once you have played one of the three enough times, you'll have learned how to perfectly shoot that hole consistently. There are three courses to select from, in what I would say to be a rising difficulty level of Forest - Twilight - Oasis. Apparently a fourth course is being made, Haunted Mansion. For the most part each hole poses its own unique, fair, but fun challenge, but some of the holes feel like a bit of a crapshoot, and on more than a few holes, glitches are present that make it impossible to complete the hole. For example, there is one hole in Twilight in which you float a ball down a river to its destination, but the ball can get caught under a bridge on the way there, and lodge itself in such a way where it is impossible to dislodge. For the most part, the holes are fine though.The physics present in the game are well tuned, though it often feels like the ball rolls a little too much, often rolling at a slow pace for up to five seconds, cutting out sizeable chunks of your limited time on the course. Generally this is quite intuitive though, and doesn't present much of a problem.The game is somewhat poorly optimized, as nearly everyone I've played with has reported some form of FPS drop in the darker areas even on lower resolutions, including myself, but my specs aren't particularly high end so I don't tend to include myself in this. The reason you're likely here, though, isn't because of physics or optimization talk, it's likely because you're one of many people who have seen the extensive youtuber gameplay of this, and wanted to play it yourself. Yes, there are outlandish ball shapes that include eggs and cones, and yes you can jump and bounce and there's low-gravity settings. This is a mostly standard minigolf game, however, that has creative course ideas and fun shapes to play with, and odd settings to use. I enjoy the game and I intend to put at least a few more hours into it, so I'm obliged to recommend it to anybody who's looking for a creative golf game in which you can torment yourself and friends by trying to put with oversized cubes that hardly move at all.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20
Early Access Review
								The best mini-golf experience money can buy.Pros:Multiple courses, All unique and vary in difficultyGreat physics (semi customizable)Custom set rules/settings (max shots per hole, ball shape, size, color, "jump" option, gravity, it goes on...The settings gives it a lot of replayability You'll never have so much fun getting frustrated with your friendsCons:Some extreme settings can make some holes impossible. (putting a cone a few places in candyland LOL) Very few ramps/runways/general ground areas don't match up perfectly which results in little bumps to crazy physics bugs. I really have nothing bad to say about this game at all, and as soon as the game starts it gives you a warning that the game is in alpha, there are bugs, it is what it is. It's not as bad as the warning makes it seem, in my opinion. The first "Con" is really on you, not the game. When you change gravity, use weird shapes, and have to jump a slightly bumpy spiral ramp, and can't make it... welll... duh. lol. The second is totally understandable, it's in alpha, and they are so far and few, it's just another thing for you and your friends to laugh and cry about, just adding to the overall experience. 100% Worth it.

content:
Posted: February 25
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								At first I thought the game was just a traditional golfing game where there added a multiplayer mode to it but I was wrong that game is really fun to play with some friends like the name would suggest.So it is any good ?Disclaimer!The game being still in alpha at the time this review will maybe not be still relavent when the game will reach gold but it deserve a critic or two.The general idea :So the game takes place on one of a few golfing courses ,with all a different themes and mechanics, those golfing course are :-Forest-Oasis-Twilight-Haunted-CandylandAll the golfing courses has 18 holes ,each holes can be completed in multiple ways which it gives some replay value and a notion of experimenting in each playthrough .No Caption ProvidedMore in detail :You can customize your ball in which ever color you want.Create and join public or private lobby.Final thoughts :There is no much to say about this game because its still in developpement. The game is really fun for a Sunday afternoon with a group of friends online ,don't expect more from this title, it’s shame the game has not yet an editor it would give the game more replay value and would really bring more people to it and by consequence create a community around this fun indy game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6
Early Access Review
								This is the best kind of early access game: it passes the "even if they never add anything to it, it was worth the purchase" test, but it also really makes me hope they DO add lots of cool stuff to it. Pros: Visual design of the levels is charming and bright. Level design of the golf courses is pretty cool and creative. Lots of custom options (low gravity, extra-bouncy ground, TURN THE GOLF BALLS INTO CUBES?!?!?) should add longevity. I haven't played a ton, but in the time I have played I haven't encountered any "early access issues" with collision detection or crashing or network connection problems. YMMVCons: Really the only problem I have is that there isn't enough of this game. The current total of 5 18-hole courses can be played in a single night. But that isn't a problem. I paid less than $4 for this game, but even for the full price of a whopping $6, this is worth it. For less than the price of a movie ticket, you and your friends will definitely get more than a movie's worth of entertainment together. And since this is just the starting point, it will hopefully only become a better value as features are added.Devs: Please make a tool for building custom holes and making your own courses! That would be the bomb!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								(Note: This review is based on how this game was back in version 0.0.96H1, available as of 14th October 2016)So far, I only played this game solo, but from playing through all currently available courses (forest, Egypt, night-time forest and haunted house), I can say that this is definitely a decent minigolf game. It plays well, the courses are nicely varied (though I wish there was more), the music is good and the graphics are nice to look at. There's no revolution, but I got exactly what I was expecting.The only complaints I would have:- There isn't any info on how exactly you're supposed to move your ball. It took me about 10 minutes before I figured out that I am supposed to hold down LMB and move the mouse forward to determine the strength of the shot and move the ball.- It sometimes is difficult to determine where exactly you're supposed to go with the ball. Some kind of map or overhead view would be much appreciated.- The game doesn't have a dedicated single player mode (you have to set up a "multiplayer" game with only 1 player).- It's not a long game. Playing solo, I only took about an hour to beat all courses.- A minor nitpick, but the flags in the last 2 courses for some reason don't move when the ball gets near.The game works well and it's exactly what I wanted. I'm looking forward to actually trying it out with a couple of friends.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
Early Access Review
								Modern golf was invented in the mid 15th century in Scotland. When the men that created it were doing so, they said," Gentleman. We do not have the technology for it yet, but eventually you will be able to do this sitting down, and you will be able to play with a myriad of shapes. You will also be able to alter the sate of gravity." Many historian can attest to the factuality of this quote. In this way, Golf With Your Friends is actually a testament to how the game was meant to be played.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Rage inducing Golf game, But super fun with friends, even with strangers!The stupidity that you can do in this game, Play with a cone instead of a ball, An egg, a square, Change the gravity, Etc.It's so frustrating!!! But not in a bad way!! In a good... Funny way...This game is challenging, and very simple at the same time, Well.. Depending what room you join!Once you get the hang of it, It's very easy, and a good game to make time go by if you're bored.Honest Rating: 8.5-1.5 Due to a couple of annoying bugs in the game that haven't seem to be fixed, and it's very annoying.Sometimes you tend to go through the floor and unable to move, And then there is also MORONS who join the game that just... waste your time, It would be nice to have a kick option.. But okay...Recommendable? YES.

								what can i say...if you want a game you will always go back to when fancying multiplayer laughs with friends... buy this...first the boring details ...the devs seem to always be on top of any issues...updates are quite frequent...new courses get added occasionally...this game has never been majorly broken for me yet (quite a rarity nowadays)...if you fancy a good game thats easy to pick up and takes a while to master this is it...and that is without the customisation options...diff ball sizes...shapes..collisions..gravity etc and the main bonus...everyone is active in game at the same time..no waiting and taking turns.... so to generally sum up...BUY IT NOW!!!!! lol

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Do you play Overwatch? Do you get repeatedly enraged by friends and/or randos that constantly disappoint you with their Hanzo ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t?Then Golf With Your Friends is the game for you. Seriously, this game is emotional therapy for Overwatch. Every time I have to get all up in someone's face like "Hey, you've been Genji for 4 minutes now and haven't contributed♥♥♥♥♥♥ why not change it up?" I know in the back of my head that it'll be okay: in just a few more minutes, I'll be hittin' a tight 18 of mini-golf with my best bros online.At the end of a long day of "ANOTHER INSTA-GENJI, COME THE ♥♥♥♥ ON", Golf With Your Friends is the serene and simple game you need.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf is a game. It is terrible. Here are some reasons why.In order to play Golf, you must purchase:An unattractive plaid vestA hilarious (ideally plaid) beretBright, ugly trousers. Preferably plaid and ideally in some disgusting shade of greenAn expensive set of golf bats (Known to professionals as 'clubs')An expensive bag to haul your golf bats around inA few friends to pretend they're interested, and join you on your escapede.A device to slow the passage of time, so that your rounds of golf don't take 36 hours eachAn understanding partner.You'll be happy to hear, then, that Golf with Friends requires absoloutely none of these things!You won't need any clothes for this game. Play naked if you like. You'll be in the comfort of your own home! Nobody will judge. Unless they can see you. In which case, they might judge.You won't need to buy friends to play with you. Announce to the world that you're going to play Golf with Friends and the world will rejoice, and line up to join you. World peace will be established, Hunger will become a thing of the past and ISIS will lay down its weapons in favour of a set of friendly golf clubs.Your partner will do the same! If you have one. If you don't, then buying Golf with Friends will make you irresistable.Games take less than 40 minutes as opposed to the 40 hours of regular golf! Hell, they take WAY less than 40 minutes sometimes.JUST BUY GOLF WITH FRIENDS. THE WORLD NEEDS MORE FRIENDS, AND NEEDS TO GOLF WITH THEM...also it's pretty cheap. You know, for all the enjoyment it brings.

content:
Posted: January 23
Early Access Review
								Pros: _Easy to pick up-Difficult to master_Super fun to play with a friend(s)_4 maps available at the time of this review_Multiple settings for gravity, ball shape, terrain rigidity etc_Looks nice_Runs at a stable fps_Price for fun ratio is very goodCons:_Early Access_Occasional bugs (clipping issues, balls bouncing/rolling forever, etc)_No tutorial or instructional graphic or anything at all explaing how the controls work (you will pick them up really quickly, but there should at least be a graphic with some text r something)_Poor filter/search options for multiplayer serversComments:This game is already worth $6 in it's current state. There are occasional bugs and graphical glitches, but it's not enough to ruin the experience. My buddy and I have had a great time with it. Lots of laughs and amazingly lucky/unlucky shots. Fooling around with the various map options makes every map play differently, so theres more depth to the game than it would apear at first glance. Honestly, I think it's pretty great. Just hard enough to be fun while still managing to be a relaxing experience. Solid thumbs up.

Early Access Review
								Do you play Overwatch? Do you get repeatedly enraged by friends and/or randos that constantly disappoint you with their Hanzo ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t?Then Golf With Your Friends is the game for you. Seriously, this game is emotional therapy for Overwatch. Every time I have to get all up in someone's face like "Hey, you've been Genji for 4 minutes now and haven't contributed♥♥♥♥♥♥ why not change it up?" I know in the back of my head that it'll be okay: in just a few more minutes, I'll be hittin' a tight 18 of mini-golf with my best bros online.At the end of a long day of "ANOTHER INSTA-GENJI, COME THE ♥♥♥♥ ON", Golf With Your Friends is the serene and simple game you need.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Where do I start?I've logged around 15 hours in the first month or so of me owning this game. That's mildly concerning.Any way, this might just be the best golf video game I've ever played. It's one of those games that, although it doesn't have next gen graphics or a compelling story, it's something special. You know it's good when the glitches aren't completely frustrating, but they rather provide some of the entertainment, especially if you're in a call with your friends.About the whole friend thing...Yeah, you basically need friends to play this game. Otherwise it's pointless. It's in the name, I mean come on.The one thing that♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off in my experience with GwYF was some of the shapes people wanted to use. I can kinda see the appeal in using a cube, but a cone? Really? It just spins. Pros- Fantastic multiplayer gameplay that will keep you entertained (and possibly hysterical) for hours- Great variation of courses with more to come- Not too demanding (my HP laptop can handle this game)- A frickin' goat statue.- A bit glitchyCons- A bit glitchy- Stupid shapes- It's only fun if you're with your friends. With random people it's just boring.If I had to give this game a rating...I'd probably give it an 8.9/10. There's still work to be done on this game, but in the meantime, the four courses provide plenty of fun for you and your friends for this sensational indie game.

You can play with random shapes like cubes and even acorns! You can customise each game for example by making the gravity lower, making the floor bouncier, making the balls (or random shapes) collide with each other, or by allowing players to make their golf balls jump! Would recommend this game!

content:

Early Access Review
								Fun game if you have friends to play with. If not, I can see this game getting old pretty fast. The concept is very easy but the course provides some tough challenges, especially if you use custom ball shapes (acorn-shape is absolutely ridiculous). Lots of fun watching your friends struggle with a hole that took you two strokes. For a simple-concept game, it is a good change of pace from the usual.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6
Early Access Review
								This isn't your dad's video golf. Fast paced, multiplayer action make this an incredible bargain for under $6. With four courses and a fifth one on the way soon, this game is a steal. There are a few small bugs as it's still in early access, but overall the game is very playable.Cons: The default setting will heat up your CPU/GPU so you need to lock the FPS to 30 or 60 instead of leaving it on 'unlimited'. Sometimes this setting will revert back and must be changed again. One obvious thing that is missing is a 'high score' record, hopefully this gets added later. Lastly, signing up for a Classic game only to have it changed to Custom at the last minute can be aggravating. I would like to see classic games locked to classic upon creation.Pros: Several custom options keep the game interesting should you get bored of playing on classic mode, and the skee ball game on the practice course is something fun to do while you wait for your party to assemble.Overall great game! 8.5/10

								Do you play Overwatch? Do you get repeatedly enraged by friends and/or randos that constantly disappoint you with their Hanzo ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t?Then Golf With Your Friends is the game for you. Every time I have to get all up in someone's face like "Hey, you've been Genji for 4 minutes now and haven't contributed♥♥♥♥♥♥ why not change it up?" I know in the back of my head that it'll be okay: in just a few more minutes, I'll be hittin' a tight 18 of mini-golf with my best bros online.At the end of a long day of "ANOTHER INSTA-GENJI, COME THE ♥♥♥♥ ON", Golf With Your Friends is the serene and simple game you need.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf With Your Friends is probably one of the top games you will get on the store for it's price. With the sale going on as we speak, I highly suggest picking up the game, even if it is to just have in your library. As the alpha testing currently shows, this game can prove to blow up to be huge one day. Pros//There is a very open and welcoming community to join into. I have been invited to play with about 5 different strangers in the course of 3 days of having the game just for being online. //Balance between competitive and chill gameplay. You can choose when to tryhard and don't have to worry about slacking a few games.//Achievements are definitely something to strive for as this game is still being developed.//Costs very little compared to other titles.//Mutator settings add variety to gameplay.//Multiplayer is both fun and exciting in a public server or a private lobby of your own.//Free roam in multiplayer lobby is definitely a new idea for a golf game.//Already has huge player base.Cons//Other than poor RGB sliders, the game has little customization implementations.//Offers little replayability. Does begin to get repetitive as you play the game.//Visuals are on the low side (thus far)Final ThoughtsI definitely do see this game going places in the future. I have seen how responsive the develpopers and moderators are both in discord and through steam. They do make sure to keep up with how the community is coming along, and how the growth of the game as well. Like I said, this game is still in it's alpha stages and has plenty of room for improvement to become outstanding so I will positively give this game a 92/100 in  it's early days. I look forward to seeing how well this game turns out!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								10/10Really fun game and couldn't say no when it was part of the Summer Steam sales. Some glitches as to be expected for an early access game but a lot have been or are getting smoothed out as time goes on. My friends and I like to all get in a TS and then let the shenanigans unfold from there which is always good for a laugh.Things that I hope they address:-adding at least 3 more maps-add a "Search" feature for finding specific lobbies-adding some sort of (optional) ingame voice chat so you can vocally talk with other people in the game-changing the hole times by increments of 15 seconds instead of 30 (hard to do a speed round in 30sec but 1 min seems to be too much as well)-enable punctuation in the lobby title (want this so I can make the title the TS IP)-some way of reducing that eternal roll your ball can get stuck in on some of the mild slopesOverall love this game and all it's other features. Jump is a little cheap but for some reason everyone seems to love it. The random shapes games can be tough enough to make one pull their hair out. I would have no problem buying this at it's current price of $5.99 even. Well worth it especially if you can get a group of friends to join in.FOUR!!

								The game is fun when you play with your friends, but if you play solo its kinda boring. But the system requirements aren't accurate at all. To wrap this review up, its a fun game, good engine, nice and fun maps too play on. Worth the 5$.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 23
Early Access Review
								Pros: _Easy to pick up-Difficult to master_Super fun to play with a friend(s)_4 maps available at the time of this review_Multiple settings for gravity, ball shape, terrain rigidity etc_Looks nice_Runs at a stable fps_Price for fun ratio is very goodCons:_Early Access_Occasional bugs (clipping issues, balls bouncing/rolling forever, etc)_No tutorial or instructional graphic or anything at all explaing how the controls work (you will pick them up really quickly, but there should at least be a graphic with some text r something)_Poor filter/search options for multiplayer serversComments:This game is already worth $6 in it's current state. There are occasional bugs and graphical glitches, but it's not enough to ruin the experience. My buddy and I have had a great time with it. Lots of laughs and amazingly lucky/unlucky shots. Fooling around with the various map options makes every map play differently, so theres more depth to the game than it would apear at first glance. Honestly, I think it's pretty great. Just hard enough to be fun while still managing to be a relaxing experience. Solid thumbs up.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Golf is a game. It is terrible. Here are some reasons why.In order to play Golf, you must purchase:An unattractive plaid vestA hilarious (ideally plaid) beretBright, ugly trousers. Preferably plaid and ideally in some disgusting shade of greenAn expensive set of golf bats (Known to professionals as 'clubs')An expensive bag to haul your golf bats around inA few friends to pretend they're interested, and join you on your escapede.A device to slow the passage of time, so that your rounds of golf don't take 36 hours eachAn understanding partner.You'll be happy to hear, then, that Golf with Friends requires absoloutely none of these things!You won't need any clothes for this game. Play naked if you like. You'll be in the comfort of your own home! Nobody will judge. Unless they can see you. In which case, they might judge.You won't need to buy friends to play with you. Announce to the world that you're going to play Golf with Friends and the world will rejoice, and line up to join you. World peace will be established, Hunger will become a thing of the past and ISIS will lay down its weapons in favour of a set of friendly golf clubs.Your partner will do the same! If you have one. If you don't, then buying Golf with Friends will make you irresistable.Games take less than 40 minutes as opposed to the 40 hours of regular golf! Hell, they take WAY less than 40 minutes sometimes.JUST BUY GOLF WITH FRIENDS. THE WORLD NEEDS MORE FRIENDS, AND NEEDS TO GOLF WITH THEM...also it's pretty cheap. You know, for all the enjoyment it brings.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18
Early Access Review
								This is a game that has the potential to be a great little minigolf game, but isn't quite there yet.  The main issue is that the dividing line between success and disaster is too fine.  When the only way to complete a hole is to hit precisely one spot, with no margin for error, the frustration level piles up quickly.  You're not alone here, Blacklight - Vertiginous Golf has essentially the same problem.  Having a rotten angle or needing to just putt out to safety is enough of a penalty; having to replay a stroke until gotten exactly right sucks the fun factor way down.It's a principle of golf course design -- and the same applies to minigolf -- that if the route to the hole is high-risk, there should be a bail out option for players who aren't at that level yet.  I certainly wouldn't play a regular golf course where every tee shot required a 300 yard carry over water with no other way to the hole.A little on-course direction would be a good idea -- it doesn't need to be precise, but when you're on a timer and don't know which way the hole is, that doesn't help the frustration level either.That said, it is a very good game.  The graphics are excellent (if a little eye-twisting on Candy Land), the mechanics are straightforward, the play is smooth, and the music is not only appropriate, it's even kind of charming.Overall, Recommended.  If the vast gulf between risk and reward narrows, I would even change that to Highly Recommended... but not yet.

								This is a game that has the potential to be a great little minigolf game, but isn't quite there yet.  The main issue is that the dividing line between success and disaster is too fine.  When the only way to complete a hole is to hit precisely one spot, with no margin for error, the frustration level piles up quickly.  You're not alone here, Blacklight - Vertiginous Golf has essentially the same problem.  Having a rotten angle or needing to just putt out to safety is enough of a penalty; having to replay a stroke until gotten exactly right sucks the fun factor way down.It's a principle of golf course design -- and the same applies to minigolf -- that if the route to the hole is high-risk, there should be a bail out option for players who aren't at that level yet.  I certainly wouldn't play a regular golf course where every tee shot required a 300 yard carry over water with no other way to the hole.A little on-course direction would be a good idea -- it doesn't need to be precise, but when you're on a timer and don't know which way the hole is, that doesn't help the frustration level either.That said, it is a very good game.  The graphics are excellent (if a little eye-twisting on Candy Land), the mechanics are straightforward, the play is smooth, and the music is not only appropriate, it's even kind of charming.Overall, Recommended.  If the vast gulf between risk and reward narrows, I would even change that to Highly Recommended... but not yet.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Pros about this game:+Not a Demanding Game+Hardly any glitches or bugs despite being in early access+Easy to play+Fun & Enjoyable especially with FRIENDS+Good Connectivity and Infomation on Server choice+Multiple Region Severs so you can play with friend overseas (US, Asia, Australia, Europe, Japan)+Customizable ball colorCons about this game:-Not alot of players YET-Too little levels at the moment (26/4/2016)-Controls are abit weird, (push forward to charge power ?)-Sometimes Crashes (1/8 times)-Cannot see the entire course unless you've played it a few timesConclusion:The game is very fun and easy to play with very nice looking graphics. Playing this game is very fun with friends and its really cheap on specs which is good as more people can play it despite owning a graphics cardless tablet... however the lack of customizable controls and lack of levels at the moment is hindering the number of people playing the game. This can be improved by having multiple sets of controls to suit different needs. Another drawback is the fact that you dont know where the hole is unless you've shot your ball or played it a few times making it very hard for hole in one for new players. It can be improved by adding a mini map or a walk around view to see what the entire course looks like. At this stage of development, i wouldn't reccomend playing this game ALONE... unless your friends have it, then buying it would be worth it !

content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								After playing this game for a quick bit, I was surprised with how much fun virtual golf could give me. The course design is very good and although the customization is pretty mediocre, the simple to learn controls and fun atmosphere certainly are a welcome to me. However, there are a few optimizations to be made, as I have a GTX 970, and can get about an average of 30 FPS. After that gets fixed, it's a pretty damn solid game. Oh, did I mention modifiers? That's a game changer as changing gravity, or giving the ability to jump adds a new element to the game which I really enjoy and adds a new way to play. I like this game yes, but with customization, and optimization, I would LOVE this game.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								Even in its early release, the game already looks awesome! The game provides a great variety of features, really nice graphics and excellent physics.Also, the developers really put effort in the game, as they constantly release new updates, hotfixes, etc...Great work!Overview:+ Game and graphics look awesome+ Physics are realistic+ "Custom settings" option provides tons of fun and usefull settings+ Light effect on the ball in darker places looks nice+ Online gameplay = tons of fun+ The current maps look awesome and I personally can't wait for a map editor.- The game sometimes appear laggy and unstable, especially when loading, even with an Intel i7-6700HQ with 8CPU's and a NVidia GTX 980m 4GB. - On some laptops and some networks, the ball suddenly stops rolling without reason. (since update Haunted House)- Some textures, like clouds and fire, look really bad, compared to the other graphics in the game.- The launch screen with options can be removed, as you can choose your options ingame. ~ If there has to be a launch screen, redesign it like it's part of the game. :)

content:
Posted: February 19
Early Access Review
								I was told about Golf With Your Friends by a friend. They gifted it to me, and after only a course I had bought it for another friend, who bought it for another friend, and so on. With a Discord server full of people playing and shouting over what the best shot is for someone on their 11th stroke (the answer is FULL POWER), I can definitely say that this game has captured the something that lets friends just play and have fun. The modifiers are great as well; 12-player with collision enabled turns Oasis into a Max Max hellscape, and Candyland with jumping turns the last hole into a game of skill.If there is one thing I would like to see in this game, it's Workshop support for custom courses. While it's still in Early Access with 5 courses and potentially more on the way, the ability to make crazy designs for a course is something I really desire. Other than that, the game is flawless.Golf With Your Friends. Full Power.Review Addendum: Please increase the max player limit to 24. We've had to start two separate lobbies because of how many people are playing at once. Heck, go the distance and make it 100. We're already in crazy town, might as well stay and set up shop.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1
Early Access Review
								*Very fun game for happy golfers*Since this is a happy golfing game it will make you happy when you play it. You can play it with FRIENDS or online with strange but happy golfers. They are often nice and happy and you have time to chat with them and to have a happy time. If someone is not happy, make him happy.You can create your own room for private fun or happy public golf. When I scroll through the game browser, I see all the room names and they are very funny. It makes me so happy.There are many options for the game like you can play as an acorn or a happy little puck. When you enable the jump feature it will offer many new ways to put your golfing ball into the hole. When I get a hole in one I am always very happy and I write "hol" into the chat. Then everyone is happy.You can also enable collisions for the game. While this could sound dangerous at first, believe me it is the opposite. With collisions on you can help other happy golfers to move their ball into the hole. The first time someone helped me, I was so happy I couldn't believe it. And now, I spread my happiness by helping others too. It makes them so happy.But in this golfing game there are no clubs. In this game, the goal is to be happy which means that you move the ball with your mouse. Remember there are no clubs. You see the ball from the outside. You are within the ball itself. You are the ball, I am the ball, we all are the ball. And it makes us happy.All in all, you should buy this fine piece of virtual golfing software technology because I will guarantee you that it will make you so happy. Especially, the new land with all the sweet candy. It is so sweet. It just makes me so happy. When you buy this game then you will not only become very happy but you will also be enlightened. Especially, when you press L. This game changed my hol life and I am so happy.

content:
Posted: March 22
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								The Tony Hawk series of games mastered the niche skateboarding genre, and the Punch Out series of games mastered the niche boxing genre, but has the Golf genre been perfected yet? I don't know, I guess there's quite a few decent golf games out there.Golf With Your Friends is trying to perfect mini-golf, and does do something better than other golf games, in my opinion-- that is you don't have to pause a lot and take turns. At the point of writing this, there are 4 different courses filled with moving obstacles, bounce pads, and other gimmicks. You can also create custom games, where you can manipulate gravity, use balls of different (or random) shapes and sizes, turn on collision, and/or turn on jumping. It even got me to spend some time trying to find hole-in-ones. There aren't any powerups or collectibles, though. I don't feel that those are necessary, but if we're trying to make the perfect golf game, I feel that those would be good to include.Golf With Your Friends is obviously going to be more enjoyable with other people. I am very lucky in that I had a large group of people on Discord, and played with like 8 people at once. And I kicked all their asses. There is a server list that lets you join other random strangers, though, if you don't have anyone to play with.

content:
Posted: February 18
Early Access Review
								This is a game that has the potential to be a great little minigolf game, but isn't quite there yet.  The main issue is that the dividing line between success and disaster is too fine.  When the only way to complete a hole is to hit precisely one spot, with no margin for error, the frustration level piles up quickly.  You're not alone here, Blacklight - Vertiginous Golf has essentially the same problem.  Having a rotten angle or needing to just putt out to safety is enough of a penalty; having to replay a stroke until gotten exactly right sucks the fun factor way down.It's a principle of golf course design -- and the same applies to minigolf -- that if the route to the hole is high-risk, there should be a bail out option for players who aren't at that level yet.  I certainly wouldn't play a regular golf course where every tee shot required a 300 yard carry over water with no other way to the hole.A little on-course direction would be a good idea -- it doesn't need to be precise, but when you're on a timer and don't know which way the hole is, that doesn't help the frustration level either.That said, it is a very good game.  The graphics are excellent (if a little eye-twisting on Candy Land), the mechanics are straightforward, the play is smooth, and the music is not only appropriate, it's even kind of charming.Overall, Recommended.  If the vast gulf between risk and reward narrows, I would even change that to Highly Recommended... but not yet.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								After playing this game for a quick bit, I was surprised with how much fun virtual golf could give me. The course design is very good and although the customization is pretty mediocre, the simple to learn controls and fun atmosphere certainly are a welcome to me. However, there are a few optimizations to be made, as I have a GTX 970, and can get about an average of 30 FPS. After that gets fixed, it's a pretty damn solid game. Oh, did I mention modifiers? That's a game changer as changing gravity, or giving the ability to jump adds a new element to the game which I really enjoy and adds a new way to play. I like this game yes, but with customization, and optimization, I would LOVE this game.
